meanings.definition: A type of magnet in which the magnetic field is produced by an electric current.
meanings.sent1: The electromagnet at the junkyard picked up the metal scraps easily.
meanings.sent2: The scientist used an electromagnet to demonstrate the power of electricity.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous robot attached an electromagnet to itself and started attracting all the spoons in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an electromagnet, drawing everyone towards her warmth and kindness.
meanings.sent5: The electromagnet hummed softly as it pulled the paperclips closer, creating a mesmerizing display of magnetic force.

meanings.definition: A device consisting of a coil of insulated wire wrapped around an iron core that becomes magnetized when an electric current flows through the wire.
meanings.sent1: The electromagnet in the crane lifted the heavy load effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: When the power went out, the electromagnet lost its magnetic properties.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved making a coin disappear using an electromagnet hidden in his sleeve.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted like an electromagnet, attracting attention and curiosity from everyone around.
meanings.sent5: The electromagnet clung tightly to the metal bar, showcasing the invisible force of magnetism in action.
